abstract: BHP Billiton and Rio Tinto pulled the plug on their plans after regulators in Australia and elsewhere signaled they would block the deal.
snippet: BHP Billiton and Rio Tinto pulled the plug on their plans after regulators in Australia and elsewhere signaled they would block the deal.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG  BHP Billiton and Rio Tinto on Monday pulled the plug on their plans to form a $116 billion iron ore joint venture after regulators in Australia and elsewhere signaled they would block the deal because of competition concerns.

headline.main: BHP and Rio Abandon Joint Mining Venture in Australia
headline.print_headline: BHP and Rio Abandon Joint Mining Venture in Australia

abstract: BHP Billiton and Rio Tinto on Monday pulled the plug on their plans to form a $116 billion iron ore joint venture after regulators in Australia and elsewhere signaled they would block the deal because of competition concerns.
snippet: BHP Billiton and Rio Tinto on Monday pulled the plug on their plans to form a $116 billion iron ore joint venture after regulators in Australia and elsewhere signaled they would block the deal because of competition concerns.
lead_paragraph: BHP Billiton and Rio Tinto on Monday pulled the plug on their plans to form a $116 billion iron ore joint venture after regulators in Australia and elsewhere signaled they would block the deal because of competition concerns, Bettina Wassener reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: BHP and Rio Abandon Australian Iron Mining Venture
